quadegories.name: fried foods
quadegories.funFact: The clam cake was invented at Aunt Carrie's, an award-winning Rhode Island restaurant, when Aunt Carrie added fresh clams to corn fritters.

quadegories.name: national parks
quadegories.funFact: Congaree National Park, located in South Carolina, is home to enormous loblolly pines and several cyprus trees well over five hundred years old.

quadegories.name: died at the alamo
quadegories.funFact: James Bonham, at age 29, is believed to have died while manning one of the canons in the interior of the Alamo chapel.

quadegories.name: dances
quadegories.funFact: The Batusie was a groovy dance invented for the Batman television series.

quadegories.name: movies about teachers
quadegories.funFact: Good Bye, Mr. Chips was once parodied as, 'Piss Off, Mr. Chips'.

quadegories.name: chess terms
quadegories.funFact: Chessmen collected from the Yaktats' people in Alaska bear no resemblance to European chessmen and likely belong to a chess tradition coming from Siberia.

quadegories.name: types of tobacco
quadegories.funFact: Shade Grown tobacco, also known as Connecticut Shade Grown Tobacco, is grown inside tents to shield it from natural sunlight.

quadegories.name: monopoly properties
quadegories.funFact: The three most landed on properties in the classic Monopoly game are Illinois Street, Go, and B&O Railroad.

quadegories.name: beans
quadegories.funFact: Other beans are Lima, Mung, Moth, and Velvet.

quadegories.name: lovers of howard hughes
quadegories.funFact: Howard Hughes once became so obsessed with the 1938 film, Gunga Din, that he had it run on a continuous loop and watched it 150 times.

quadegories.name: nicknames for grandparents
quadegories.funFact: 33% of grandparents have been married more than once and 38% have sex at least twice a week.

quadegories.name: jewish kings
quadegories.funFact: Other Jewish Kings include Solomon, Aristobulus II, and Herod the Great.

quadegories.name: volcanos
quadegories.funFact: Volcanoes are classified as Active, Dormant, or Extinct.

quadegories.name: Medical Slang
quadegories.funFact: The term 'Stat' comes from the Latin word 'Statim,' meaning 'immediately.'

quadegories.name: Fictional Horses
quadegories.funFact: Flicka is a Swedish word meaning 'little girl,' reflecting the close bond in the story.

quadegories.name: Television Sergeants
quadegories.funFact: Sergeant Bilko, from 'The Phil Silvers Show,' was one of TV's first major sitcom hits.

quadegories.name: Spent Time in Jail
quadegories.funFact: Socrates was sentenced to death for 'corrupting the youth' and promoting unorthodox ideas.

quadegories.name: Search Engines
quadegories.funFact: Alta Vista was one of the first web search engines, launched in 1995.

quadegories.name: Pianists
quadegories.funFact: Vladimir Horowitz was one of the first classical pianists to perform on live television.

quadegories.name: Famous Clowns
quadegories.funFact: Bozo the Clown became so popular that multiple actors played him simultaneously in different cities.

quadegories.name: Types of Pickles
quadegories.funFact: Kosher dill pickles got their name from traditional Jewish pickle-making methods.

quadegories.name: Names for Iceland
quadegories.funFact: Iceland's nickname 'Saga Island' reflects its rich history of Viking sagas.

quadegories.name: Directed by Frank Capra
quadegories.funFact: 'It Happened One Night' was the first film to win all five major Academy Awards.

quadegories.name: Types of Badgers
quadegories.funFact: The Honey Badger is famously fearless, taking on predators much larger than itself!

quadegories.name: words for kissing
quadegories.funFact: Osculate is the scientific term for kissing, derived from Latin.

quadegories.name: Characters in Alice in Wonderland
quadegories.funFact: The Dodo in Alice in Wonderland is a self-insert by author Lewis Carroll.

quadegories.name: Parts of an Acorn
quadegories.funFact: Acorns were once a staple food for many ancient civilizations.

quadegories.name: Cities in Oregon
quadegories.funFact: Salem, Oregon, is nicknamed the 'Cherry City' for its historical cherry-growing industry.

quadegories.name: Types of Cactus
quadegories.funFact: The Prickly Pear cactus produces fruit that is both edible and delicious!

quadegories.name: Tunnels
quadegories.funFact: The Lincoln Tunnel connects New York and New Jersey under the Hudson River.

quadegories.name: Types of Diamonds
quadegories.funFact: The Canary diamond is famous for its vibrant yellow color caused by nitrogen impurities.

quadegories.name: Owls
quadegories.funFact: Snowy Owls can survive Arctic winters with their heavily insulated feathers.

quadegories.name: Ghosts
quadegories.funFact: The Flying Dutchman is a legendary ghost ship doomed to sail the seas forever.

quadegories.name: Types of Bridges
quadegories.funFact: Covered bridges were designed to protect their wooden structure from the elements.

quadegories.name: Brands of Soda Pop
quadegories.funFact: Nehi soda was named after the 'knee-high' level of its original bottles.

quadegories.name: Cars Named After Animals
quadegories.funFact: The Ford Mustang, another animal-named car, is one of the most iconic American muscle cars.

quadegories.name: Epitaphs
quadegories.funFact: Jack Lemmon's epitaph humorously references his film career with 'In...'.

quadegories.name: Rhodes Scholars
quadegories.funFact: Rhodes Scholars are selected not just for academics but for leadership potential.

quadegories.name: Bands Named After Places
quadegories.funFact: Asia’s hit 'Heat of the Moment' topped charts in the 1980s.

quadegories.name: Presidential Nicknames
quadegories.funFact: John Tyler was nicknamed 'His Accidency' because he became president after Harrison’s death.

quadegories.name: Golf Terms
quadegories.funFact: Ironically, "Golf" spelled backwards is "Flog."

quadegories.name: Characters in the novel To Kill a Mockingbird
quadegories.funFact: Zeebo, son of Finch family housekeeper Calpurnia, works for the town of Maycomb and removes Tim Johnson, the mad dog killed by Atticus.

quadegories.name: Indian Reservations
quadegories.funFact: In 2000, the poverty rate at Navajo Nation Reservation was 46.5% for families with children, compared to the national average of 9.2%.

quadegories.name: Nicknames for Margaret
quadegories.funFact: 'Pegeen' is the Irish diminutive form of 'Margaret,' derived from Mairead.

quadegories.name: Types of Pudding
quadegories.funFact: Yorkshire pudding was historically made to stretch meat drippings into a filling side dish.

quadegories.name: Died while having sex
quadegories.funFact: Death during consensual sex accounts for approximately 0.6% of all sudden deaths.

quadegories.name: Battles of WWI
quadegories.funFact: The Battle of Loos marked the first time the British used poison gas in combat.

quadegories.name: Edgar Allan Poe characters
quadegories.funFact: Poe’s father abandoned him and his siblings after their mother’s death, leaving them destitute.

quadegories.name: Mayors of New York City
quadegories.funFact: Abraham Beame, at 5'2", boxed as a flyweight growing up in New York’s Lower East Side.

quadegories.name: Toothpaste Ingredients
quadegories.funFact: Fluoride prevents tooth decay by strengthening enamel and making teeth more resistant to acids.

quadegories.name: Invented by Women
quadegories.funFact: Bette Nesmith Graham invented Liquid Paper while working as a typist to fix typing mistakes.

quadegories.name: Concentration Camps
quadegories.funFact: The largest Nazi concentration camp, Auschwitz, held over 1.3 million prisoners.

quadegories.name: Types of Sugar
quadegories.funFact: Confectioners' sugar is finely ground and often mixed with a small amount of anti-caking agent.

quadegories.name: Spices
quadegories.funFact: Turmeric, a bright yellow spice, is often used for its anti-inflammatory properties.

quadegories.name: Baseball Commissioners
quadegories.funFact: Bart Giamatti was Yale University’s president before becoming MLB commissioner.

quadegories.name: Pornographic Actors
quadegories.funFact: Stormy Daniels met Donald Trump at a celebrity golf tournament while promoting adult films.

quadegories.name: Computer Viruses
quadegories.funFact: The Melissa virus caused $80 million in damages and overloaded email servers worldwide.

quadegories.name: Twins
quadegories.funFact: Romulus and Remus, mythical founders of Rome, were suckled by a she-wolf.

quadegories.name: Chemists
quadegories.funFact: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and the only one to win in two sciences.

quadegories.name: Original Star Trek Characters
quadegories.funFact: Mr. Spock’s Vulcan salute is based on a Hebrew priestly blessing.

quadegories.name: Types of Brick
quadegories.funFact: The oldest known bricks date back to 7000 BC in the Middle East.

quadegories.name: Characters from the game Clue
quadegories.funFact: The character 'Mrs. White' was removed from newer versions of the game Clue.

quadegories.name: Horse Breeds
quadegories.funFact: The Florida Cracker horse is one of the oldest and rarest horse breeds in the United States.

quadegories.name: Cones
quadegories.funFact: Pine cones are reproductive organs of conifer trees, protecting seeds until maturity.

quadegories.name: Bridges
quadegories.funFact: Adam’s Bridge, also known as Rama’s Bridge, connects India to Sri Lanka.

quadegories.name: Names for the Devil
quadegories.funFact: 'Mephistopheles' originates from German folklore and means 'destroyer of light.'

quadegories.name: Owls
quadegories.funFact: The Snowy Owl can survive extreme Arctic winters with its thick feathers.

quadegories.name: Tennis Players
quadegories.funFact: Monica Seles was stabbed by a fan during a match in 1993.

quadegories.name: Fish Parts
quadegories.funFact: The dorsal fin helps fish maintain balance and prevents rolling.

quadegories.name: Deserts
quadegories.funFact: The Mojave Desert is the driest desert in North America.

quadegories.name: Cameras
quadegories.funFact: The Polaroid camera revolutionized photography by enabling instant development.
